en.meta.title: CircuitPython - Custom File Systems
en.meta.description: A set of examples of custom file systems and block-level devices for CircuitPython that can be used for educational purposes and expanded upon.
en.article.subtitle: View on GitHub
en.intro.title: Introduction
en.intro.p1: This project contains a set of examples of custom file systems and block-level devices for CircuitPython that can be used for educational purposes and expanded upon.
en.intro.p2: All these examples are thoroughly documented in order to allow you to understand how each method of a virtual FS/BLD works, and also to show you some of the undocumented methods for these.
en.requirements.title: Requirements
en.requirements.1: A MCU with CircuitPython 8.0 or newer
en.requirements.1.1: Access to the zlib  (Required for most block-level devices)
en.requirements.1.2: Wi-Fi connectivity is required for some examples
en.requirements.1.3: Around 1MiB of disk space and 48 KiB of RAM free on the MCU
en.requirements.2: A way to mount disk images on you computer for block-level projects
en.requirements.2.1: ImDisk's Ram Disk tool is recommended for Windows.
en.requirements.2.2: I don't know about Linux, sorry.
en.requirements.3: A lot of patience to deal with some of CircuitPython's quirks
en.fs.title: File Systems
en.fs.blank.title: Blank
en.fs.blank.p1:
Blank file system with a lot of comments on how each procedure works and what it should return.
When its content is listed, it is shown as being empty.
en.fs.blank.p2: This file system has a LOT more comments than the others which explains in much more details how each important method works.
en.fs.rom.title: Read-Only Memory
en.bld.title: Block-level Devices
en.bld.stub.title: Stub
en.bld.stub.p1: Stub of a generic block-level class without any code, but detailed comments for each required methods and their warnings and notes.
en.bld.stub.p2: The reasoning behind not making this one a working class is that block-level devices require quite a bit more code to make them work as you need to create a working MBR and FAT partition.
en.bld.remote.title: Remote
en.warning.title: Warning
en.warning.p1: Due to the way some commands are executed, it is possible to have a command injection vulnerability if you mess up or leave the config file editable by everyone.
en.warning.p2: This might be fixed in the future, but don't count on it as this project is a personal one.
en.features.title: Features
en.links.title: Links

fr.meta.title: CircuitPython - Systèmes de fichiers personalisés
fr.meta.description: Un set de systèmes de fichiers et stockage en blocs personnalisés pour CircuitPython qui peuvent être utilisés afin d'apprendre leur fonctionnement ou améliorés et implémentés dans d'autres solutions.
fr.article.subtitle: Voir sur GitHub
fr.intro.title: Introduction
fr.intro.p1: Ce projet contient un set de systèmes de fichiers et stockage en blocs personnalisés pour CircuitPython qui peuvent être utilisés afin d'apprendre leur fonctionnement ou améliorés et implémentés dans d'autres solutions.
fr.intro.p2:
Tous ces exemples sont soigneusement documentés afin de vous permettre de comprendre le fonctionnement de chaque méthode d'un système de fichiers virtuel ou d'un stockage en blocs
Et en plus de cela, ils vous montreront certaines des méthodes non documentées.
fr.requirements.title: Dépendances
fr.requirements.1: Un MCU avec CircuitPython 8.0 ou une version plus récente
fr.requirements.1.1: Access to the zlib  (Required for most block-level devices)
fr.requirements.1.2: Wi-Fi connectivity is required for some examples
fr.requirements.1.3: Around 1MiB of disk space and 48 KiB of RAM free on the MCU
fr.requirements.2: A way to mount disk images on you computer for block-level projects
fr.requirements.2.1: ImDisk's Ram Disk tool is recommended for Windows.
fr.requirements.2.2: I don't know about Linux, sorry.
fr.requirements.3: A lot of patience to deal with some of CircuitPython's quirks
fr.warning.title: Avertissements
fr.warning.p1: Due au fait que certaines commandes sont exécutées avec des paramètres arbitraires configurables cette application est vulnérable aux attaques par injection de commande si le fichier de configuration est modifiable par des personnes non autorisées.
fr.warning.p2: Ce problème sera probablement réglé dans le futur, mais il n'y a pas de date fixe comme ce projet est plus personnel qu'autre-chose.
